description.narrative:
Sveza Holding (or the company) is the largest birch plywood producer in Russia and accounts for 10% of the global production of birch plywood. Sveza owns three plywood plants producing birch plywood, particleboard, and bed slats mainly utilized in construction, furniture production and transportation industries, and several logging companies in various regions of Russia. This project will support Svezas 2004-2007 investment program, which comprises of:
- capital expenditures and modernization program for Svezas plywood plants, - expansion of the companys harvesting infrastructure, and - refinancing of existing short-term debt. This project will enable Sveza to increase the quality of its existing products, widen its product selection, and lower its production costs and raw material consumption through the replacement of older production equipment. The company will further expand its harvesting and sawmilling infrastructure which will improve the companys raw material self sufficiency. In addition to the above, the refinancing component will help the company reduce its funding cost and lower its maturity mismatch by replacing existing expensive short-term loans by long-term funding.

name.narrative: Svezas existing mills include Fanplit (Kostroma, Kostroma Oblast), Novator (Veliky Ustjug, Vologda Oblast) and Ust Izhora (St. Petersburg, Leningrad Oblast). The Fanplit mill includes two sites, the original mill in the middle of Kostroma, and a new site in an industrial suburb. The Novator plant is located in the industrial area of Veliky Ustiug, in close proximity to good raw material base. The Ust Izhora plant is located in the suburbs of St. Petersburg and close to the Port of St. Petersburg, providing a benefit for export operations.
